Description: Upper body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with turn of neck; interior: glazed black (fired reddish); exterior: neck glazed; band at junction of neck and shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of padded dancers (left arm of one dancer, to left and bearded head and upper body of second dancer, to right remaining).
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.1155 and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA174. It also belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1304 and may belong to the same vessel as Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA173. Seeberg states that the vessel was produced by a painter in the Klyka Group. Seeberg, A., Corinthian Komos Vases. London 1971, 54.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.032) (Phase 1)
